required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anlotinib Plus Everolimus as First-line Treatment for Advanced Non Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Single Arm, Single Center, Prospective, Phase II Clinical Study of Anlotinib Hydrochloride Capsule Combined With Everolimus in the First-line Treatment of Advanced Non Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-centre, single-arm, phase 2 study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of anlotinib hydrochloride plus everolimus in patients with advanced non clear renal cell carcinoma as first-line treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a single-arm, phase II trial in non-clear renal cell carcinoma patients. The purpose of this trial is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of anlotinib hydrochloride combined with everolimus in patients with no systematic treatment advanced non clear renal cell carcinoma.
The primary objective: Overall Response Rate(ORR)(according to RECIST version 1.1). The second objectives: progression free survival (PFS), disease control rate (DCR), Overall Survival(OS) and safety.

primary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as the percentage of participants in the analysis population who experienced a Complete Response (CR; disappearance of all target lesions) or a Partial Response (PR; at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions) and was assessed using RECIST 1.1 based on investigator evaluation.

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) and stable disease (SD)

The PFS time is defined as time from randomization to locoregional or systemic recurrence, second malignancy or death due to any cause; censored observations will be the last date of: "death", "last tumor assessment", "last follow up date" or "last date in drug log"

OS was defined as time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause. For participants still alive at the time of analysis, OS time was censored on last date that participants were known to be alive.

arm_group.description: Anlotinib hydrochloride: ,12 mg given orally, once daily in 21-day cycle (14 days on treatment from Day 1-14, 7 days off treatment from Day 15-21). Everolimus:5mg po. qd in 21-day cycle

intervention.description: Anlotinib hydrochloride is a multi-target receptor tyrosine kinase inhibitor.

facility.name: 270 Dongan Road, Fudan University Shanghai Cancer Center
